channel.title: Acne Irl! ~ Photo Manipulation & Airbrushing
channel.description:
[center][img]http://i14.tinypic.com/8a37p8m.png[/img][/center]
[center]This thread has been getting a little more attention than I'd first imagined. It's a shame it's the wrong kind of attention. I posted this here because I know that the graphics forum on MITB is quite a good one. It's a good atmosphere and gives me the opportunity to talk with skilled, likeminded people, and at best, help me improve my graphics skills and techniques. Photo manipulation is one of the techniques that I'm not as good at, that's why I've posted it here for your advice and feedback.
[b]Before;[/b] [img]http://i15.tinypic.com/81gz415.png[/img]
[b]After;[/b] [img]http://i7.tinypic.com/6jg7ouo.png[/img]
[i]I have noticed that alot of you have been suggesting that I make the image a little more tanned. I suck at filters and colours and all that sort of stuff, so forgive me if I've done this wrong.[/i]
[b]Tanned;[/b] [img]http://i2.tinypic.com/8fjrevt.png[/img]
[i]-[/i][b]JV[/b][/center]

item.title: Acne Irl! ~ Photo Manipulation & Airbrushing
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“eVokki`, post:56, topic:168508”]As you asked me to post on this thread I am doing so:

The method used to get rid of the acne is ok but the tanning is completely fucked up, personally what I did with my picture was find a certain " warm " colour on the picture somewhere and then quickly fill in the parts of the photo that need tanning with it, lower the fill and the opacity until it’s a lighter colour. Then use about a feather of 3-4px with the lasso tool to roughly go around the outline on your picture and then delete the reverse of it. Once done just use a soft brush to fill in the last bits of the tan. Then if needed use a warm photofilter on it.

?[/quote]

THANKYOU

Read full topic

item.title: Acne Irl! ~ Photo Manipulation & Airbrushing
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

As you asked me to post on this thread I am doing so:

The method used to get rid of the acne is ok but the tanning is completely fucked up, personally what I did with my picture was find a certain " warm " colour on the picture somewhere and then quickly fill in the parts of the photo that need tanning with it, lower the fill and the opacity until it’s a lighter colour. Then use about a feather of 3-4px with the lasso tool to roughly go around the outline on your picture and then delete the reverse of it. Once done just use a soft brush to fill in the last bits of the tan. Then if needed use a warm photofilter on it.

?

Read full topic

item.title: Acne Irl! ~ Photo Manipulation & Airbrushing
item.dc:creator: @JV1 JV
item.description:
@JV1 wrote:

[quote=“Not X A Alex, post:47, topic:168508”][quote author=frost21 link=topic=228109.msg1972167#msg1972167 date=1199335879]

i passed this worker at a supermarket the other day and they looked like you…with the acne

I love the pertinence of these forums.

yea, it was gross, i vomitted.

Surely vomiting in public is more gross and embarassing than having a common skin disorder? =/

no
proactive
consider it. or go to the doctor.

Wow why are you posting such useless shit…he wants help on how to make it better.I really dont think he cares too much of what you think about his acne.
[/quote]
no way thanks captain obvious.
but anyway ontopic since i forgot to actually stick to it.

looks pretty realistic its great tanned.[/quote]

Thanks for the feedback.
It wasn’t worth the other three posts of pure spam though.

KIR
-Jv

Read full topic
